Reviews.Title: “Good Location, Great Customer Service”
Reviews.Author: ExUSA
Reviews.Content: This is a good location, but what made this hotel stand out for me was the staff. I was traveling alone on Christmas Eve and had nothing to do, and the staff made sure I had a great experience. This isnt something you'd expect in a such a big city like London, but they were kind, courteous, and really know the city! My room was sized exactly what I would expect for the price I paid for the room, but it was clean and comfortable. I would not hesitate to stay here again, as it was one of the best customer service experiences I've ever had at a hotel.

Reviews.Title: “not a pleasant experience”
Reviews.Author: Dannibenyon
Reviews.Content: Obviously we knew that this would not be perfect, but we found our stay very unpleasant. I was just relieved we were out at a party so did not spend much time there. Firstly, we booked double room, but were given a twin, and could not change to double as none left. That would have been OK, it was how dirty the room was that I did not like. Handprints on the wall, filthy lightswitch, broken bed, had to pull the bed out to reach the plug socket and behind was very dirty. We did not trust the cleanliness at all so used spare clothing we had brought with us to sleep on. There isn't a single feature about this hotel I would recommend. Maybe other rooms might be slightly better, but not ours. And to top it off, when we arrived back from the party freezing and tired, there was someone randomly lying on the hall floor. Quite an overall experience!

Reviews.Title: “good position, basic hotel”
Reviews.Author: patrizia-pat
Reviews.Content: It's an old hotel with 30 rooms and the breakfast room at the lower floor. My room was very basic and the bathroom is really small, tiny sink and shower. The position is excellent. If you like to walk you can go to Westminster, Buckingham, Harrods... on foot. Otherwise the Victoria station underground is 2 minute walking. I had an english breakfast, pretty good. If you don't expect too much, it' s good option.

Reviews.Title: “Value for money but be warned it is not The Ritz”
Reviews.Author: karulann
Reviews.Content: It is cheap, just walking distance to Victoria Station and Victoria Bus Station and traditional english breakfast. The breakfast was surprisingly good, wasn't expecting it. Rooms are a bit outdated, but it didn't matter as long as it is clean and the bed are comfortable as we were out most of the day. The staff are pretty friendly. As long as you do not put high expectation, this hotel is good enough for budget traveller who do not want to spend more on accommodation and are not comfortable to stay in a hostel. I gave this hotel a 'very good' rating for the breakfast and location itself.

Reviews.Title: “No frills accommodation”
Reviews.Author: tigerly1
Reviews.Content: We needed good value accommodation for Rememberance Weekend and a friend suggested Stanley House. Well they were not wrong, we found it to be a surprisingly good example. The room was simply furnished, with friendly staff and with close proximity to Victoria Station it ticked all the essential boxes. We would ( and will) recommend this hotel to friends and family.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT LOCATION..GOOD VALUE”
Reviews.Author: HERB24
Reviews.Content: This hotel is not the Ritz....it is great value for money. The rooms are basic, my rooms have always been clean and staff have always been friendly. Breakfast is basic English. Location is minutes from Victoria Station and Gatwick Express, just a few more minutes to the Palace and or Westminster. There is a great local pub within 75 yards, several restaurants, a deli and convenience store. Once again great value for money, I have booked my next stay for 2012 and I know what too expect....clean, comfortable, convenient and value.

Reviews.Title: “Bad hotel, good location”
Reviews.Author: dfowman
Reviews.Content: My wife was not happy with my choice of booking this hotel. The room was run down and dirty. The window latch was broken and the door lock and latch were also broken. Anyone could have gotten in our room. The bed spread was old and thin and the bed was uncomfortable. the bathroom was extremely small. The sink was the smallest I'd ever seen. I would definitely not stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Only the location is good...Terrible hotel”
Reviews.Author: Daniel T
Reviews.Content: Terrible staff, only the guy in the reception was friendly. The rooms were smelly, there was dust everywhere, dirty walls and the bathroom was in a really bad shape. In the bathroom there was a bed pan (?!?!?) and there was no shower curtain. Stayed there for two days and left....just couldn't bare anymore of that. I can't understand how something like that can still be opened to servince.

Reviews.Title: “One night was enough”
Reviews.Author: aussiemiss
Reviews.Content: I needed a hotel for one night which was near Victoria Station. The room was a cheap price and the quality of the hotel reflected this. I had a room with an ensuite, which had an unpleasant odour when I used the shower. The room was a reasonable size but the beds took up most of the space, the other furnishings were very basic. I am very glad I only stayed one night there and unless you cannot afford anything more expensive, I do not recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Very basic and poor condition”
Reviews.Author: Helen R
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Stanley House Hotel in Belgrave Road for just two nights, which was too many! The hotel decor was in a poor state of repair. The mirror in our room was broken, there were hairs on the headboard and a grubby mark on the wall behind the headboard from someone's head! Our friends stayed in the room next to ours and their tap was hanging. The basin was so small they couldnt wash in it properly. The location of the hotel was excellent but I would not wish to stay there in the future. I would rather pay a little extra for a clean, well kept hotel.

Reviews.Title: “clean with a good location”
Reviews.Author: midnightlegend
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for one night in August, the hotel is in a good location close to Victoria station, the rooms were clean but very basic and dated but was in keeping with the whole building. The staff were polite and friendly and breakfast was good. There is no tea or coffee facility in your room but a vending machine is located on the ground floor. Free WiFi is available. Spending more than 3 days here could be a grind but for 1 or 2 nights for somewhere to sleep its perfect just dont expect the Ritz, reminded me of a boarding house in the late 80s. We are coming to see Wicked in a few weeks and wouls certainly stop here again.

Reviews.Title: “Good location but poor service”
Reviews.Author: raima76
Reviews.Content: The location of the hotel was good and we managed to get about on foot to the nearest tube station and to Westminster on foot. We stayed in the family room which was tired but adequate for a budget price of £120 for the night. The room was basic but the bed linen and towels were clean. We did find the reception staff less than welcoming on arrival and there was a problem with parking our car. On the website we booked through - easytobook.com - it said that there was a discounted price of £9 per 24hours for nearby parking, but the reception staff were unaware of this and said that the information was wrong. We managed to agree that we would pay £20 for 24hours and wasn't much else we could do apart from agree. the discount on the car parking was one of the main reasons for booking this hotel. The next morning whilst going for breakfast, a different receptionist called me over and more or less demanded that I needed to pay up the £20 for parking there and then! He was very rude and seemed to forget using any ounce of manners, saying 'you must pay this now', etc. This was upsetting as I had my three young children with me and wanted to sort the matter out after breakfast. Not much of a warm welcome first thing in the morning. The breakfast staff were helpful and the food was adequate - although there were no highchairs which proved difficult. I wouldn't recommend that you stay at this hotel if you are bringing your car or if you expect decent hospitality - after all, it's not free!

Reviews.Title: “Worst hotel ever. Do not go there.”
Reviews.Author: donnakaren43
Reviews.Content: Positives: Clean sheets and towels. Breakfast was good. Negatives: Everything else. We stayed with mother in law. She had a room on the bottom floor by the front office, and it was mediocre. Bathroom had a good shower and a real door. Our room was on the 2nd floor (really 2 stories up from first though), and it had a tacked on ensuite bathroom. When you flushed the toilet, sewer water came up in the shower drain and the room was filled with methane gas. Window was cracked when we arrived, and this was necessary to prevent asphyxiation. Hotel would have been shut down in US for health reasons. Other than that? Flushed toilet above startled us from a sound sleep. Loud arguments in the streets kept us up. Bed was hard as a rock. Bathroom just stunk to high heaven, though it looked clean. Tiny room - hard to walk around. Had to queue for breakfast about 20 min. One step above sleeping in the park under a tarp. Sleeping in the airport is better.

Reviews.Title: “GSOH will see you thru!”
Reviews.Author: BevnTich
Reviews.Content: I would agree with a lot of the above comments. We have stayed here twice and are about to stay again in June. We stayed just one night previously but are staying 2 nights this time. First time was because of a cock up with the hotel we booked originally and a friend and I were in London for Mama Mia. Yes, the decor is dated, but we just wanted somewhere really close to victoria that did brekkie. Lots of them don't. I thought the brekkie was actually ok for the price. The second time was when me and Hubbie went to see the Foo's and, to be honest, I was soooo excited re the concert, I didn't care re the room. I booked it, cos I knew where it was, and it's proximity to victoria. We are up again in June for a trip on the Orient Express and to see Dirty Dancing, so we booked it for ease (and the price). Our experience was that the staff were polite and friendly (we asked them questions re the tube as we're not regular London goers). We just found the loo arrangement hilarious, as it was a step up about a foot and the loo was right there! I think it is true that you get what you pay for but prob wouldnt stay there with young kids. I totally get the lady from Bolton's view. Go with low expectations and a gsoh and you will be ok!

Reviews.Title: “Nice friendly hotel”
Reviews.Author: NikkiS08
Reviews.Content: We realized after our arrival, that Park hotel (Belgrave road) cancelled our reservation, so we had to find new one. We were lucky, because this hotel had one free room for us and price was good. It was near the Victoria station, so it was really good. Men on the reception was everytime really nice and helpfull, when we needed something. Room was nice, clean. Every day clean towels. I don´t like too much hotel´s bathroom, but I can say, that this hotel surprised me, it was really nice clean bathroom. There was nothing, what i wouldn´t like.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, that's all”
Reviews.Author: warren333
Reviews.Content: Its very hard to find a good hotel in london on a budget. And the search continues. Close to buck palace and victoria station,but thats it. Room small, strip lights on ceiling(the kind you have in a garage or kichen), carpet dirty, no bedside lights, some electrical sockets you couldnt even get a plug in, shower drain blocked, bed spread from the 70's, hard bed, no tea making facilities, old shabby cupbards. Room did have a tv. Full english breakfast, served up on a saucer. One rasher of bacon, one sausage, table spoon of beans and an egg. Big heap of toast though. All in all it was very poor value even for london standards. Dont take my word for it, book yourself in and a for room 3 and listen to everyones coming and goings throughout the night. Enjoy.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Edgardmx
Reviews.Content: I stayed for one night in this hotel before going to Liverpool and all i can say is that the location is amazing, very close to the Victoria Station, Buckingham palace, London Eye, Big Ben... You can walk everywhere! The room ws on, with bathroom en-suite, clean. The breakfast is ok, and staff very kind and helpfull! I will stay there again fo sure!

Reviews.Title: “Just don't Stay Here”
Reviews.Author: karenleg
Reviews.Content: If you thinking about staying at the Stanley House Hotel, don't do it.....just don't do it. The old adage of you get what you pay for is certainly true when it comes to this hotel. My wife and I stayed there for 4 nights and were quite prepared to accept a basic, budget hotel. We have stayed in budget hotels in London on 2 previous ocassions and we were not expecting 5 star, but this was a nightmare stay in London. The rooms are tiny, the double bed is tiny with 1small blanket, which is not sufficient in the middle of winter especially when the heater does not work. In fact, during our 4 night stay we had to move rooms 3 times due to a basin where the water took 10 minutes to run down and a heater that did not work. Eventually 3 nights later they gave us a portable fan heater. This had a loose wire and you had to wiggle it around for a few minutes to get it to work. I am quite happy with a basic breakfast but if I have cereal, I would like to at least put my own milk in my cereal bowl. In an effort to ration (I can only imagine this is the reason) the breakfast, the cereal is served with the milk already in the bowl.....that was a first for us, so really keep looking for another hotel.....

Reviews.Title: “Great location for reasonable price”
Reviews.Author: Mir929
Reviews.Content: Booked the hotel through the Internet and had no problem with the reservation. The absolute plus is the location - about 100 metres from Victoria Station and we found it very easily. We had a triple room - for me, my husband and daughter. The room was not very big but not very small either, which is not what I can say about the bathroom - very small, a bugger man would find it hard to turn around while having a shower. Since we were there in April, we were quite worried about the weather but it was great - sunny and almost no rain. The heating in the room was on all the time, so we didn't feel cold, just the opposite. The breakfast was the same every day but we didn't mind and the staff was really helpful. I would recommend it to people for the location, friendly staff and, of course, the price.

Reviews.Title: “Disgusting ,over-priced hell hole, avoid at all costs !!!!!”
Reviews.Author: cazlol1
Reviews.Content: On arrival the staff were very rude and had the bare minimum understanding of english . The room was so small and very very hot , also i had my 6 yr old girl with me and there wasn't a lock on the window which opened so wide it could fit a grown man through!! A new lock was drilled onto it 2 hours after complaining , yet i still didnt feel safe and couldn't sleep due to this and a horrendous bed with rock hard pillows. The standard of the breakfast was way below average and had to share our table with 2 other families.We checked out a day early . It still makes my stomach churn thinking about it , eugh !!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Try somewhere else first.”
Reviews.Author: Cogo56
Reviews.Content: A typical cut-price London hotel: good location & clean, but cramped and dated interior. The shower is the smallest we've seen! You get what you pay for. We stayed on two occasions in June 2010, and made a booking at reception to stay again in July. They "lost" this booking, and were particularly unhelpful in trying to assist - leaving us on the street at 10pm with two children and all hotels in the area full. We'd stay somewhere else next time.

Reviews.Title: “Fresh on the outside old on inside”
Reviews.Author: Mich55_10
Reviews.Content: This hotel is old on the inside but clean, breakfast was great as was the service, Reception "Khan" was of great help also. In a great location for all attractions. For the price I give it the thumbs up

Reviews.Title: “very central and convienint if your not fussy.”
Reviews.Author: Honda-Power-Naxxar
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very central and very close to Victoria station. The rooms are very basic and the shower/toilet very small but clean. Our room was on the third floor and no lift available so carrying the luggage up and down is a nightmare. Breakfast was ok but sharing the table is not very nice at times. The staff were helpful and friendly. We were out doors most of the time so mainly needed the hotel to sleep and shower.

Reviews.Title: “Very poor, stay clear of this place!!!”
Reviews.Author: ScottD2009
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in many hotels over the years and have always had an enjoyable experience, but this one was a shocker. After reading the mainly positive reviews I was looking forward to my trip, but obviously none of these guys stayed in room 17!! I know this is a budget hotel but come on! The bed had seen better days, you couldn't use the drawers as they were filthy and stained, there was only 1 working plug socket (which the light above the bed was plugged into), and I have been on ships in storms that move less than the floorboards! They en-suite is actually a cupboard with a toilet and the worlds smallest shower and sink. Seriously. I am only of average build, but once in the 50cm (I'm not joking) shower there was no room to manouver. The shower head only dribbled on one side. No tea making facilities either, just a vend machine at 40p a go. And you could not watch the 12inch t.v as there was too much interference. The view out of the window was pigeons, pigeon mess and a decaying building (which I was staying in!). You could see the London eye in the background though! However the worse thing about this place was the heat. There were no windows open anywhere. We were due to stay from Weds to Friday but it was so uncomfortable we checked out Thurs. I have never had to check out early because things were so bad! Please do not be fooled by the reasonable rates - this place is not worth a penny!

Reviews.Title: “Dissapointing”
Reviews.Author: Droblin
Reviews.Content: Stayed 3 nights and wasn't impressed at all. The location is good but the hotel itself is a bit cheap and nasty. The room was small, bathroom smelled and the sheets/towels could have been cleaner. Breakfast was ok, but the dining room was filthy. Wouldn't stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Average”
Reviews.Author: AnaCai
Reviews.Content: We stayed in for 1 night only. The location is great as it's just a few minutes walk from Victoria station. The price was a little high compared to the other hotel we stayed in but it includes a nice breakfast (full english). Linen, towels and toilet (which was tiny) were clean but the floor was very bumpy and carpeted. The night was relatively silent but the shades poorly black-outed the outside light. The room was hot (no AC) and the TV had bad reception.

Reviews.Title: “Very good for the price you pay”
Reviews.Author: k2rt
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel for three days and it we didn't have any problems there. I had heard that hotel rooms are very small in London but our double room on the ground floor was very roomy. And the bathroom was fine as well. The decor didn't look very new and floors under the carpet were a bit bumpy but everything was very clean. The location of this hotel is very good because it's about 5-minute walk from the Victoria station. They offered english and continental breakfast. The breakfast room was quite small and as the hotel was full during our stay it got a little crowded just before 9 am (breakfast was from 7.30 to 9) and we even had to wait for some minutes to get the table. However, the service was quick and the waiting didn't bother us.

Reviews.Title: “Average for the price”
Reviews.Author: Dr_B_Maitra
Reviews.Content: Location : Walking distance from Victoria Coach Station, Victoria Rail Station and Underground. Convenient for traveling to the other parts of the country and also within London by Metro. Sainsbury just behind the hotel as also 3 Indian Restaurants on Wilton Street. Most of the tour coaches commences their journey from the Victoria Coach Station. Staff : Very friendly and helpful always by your side when you need their opinions on tours/markets/flea markets etc. Rooms: Clean, tidy, newly painted. Bed not very cosy, gives you a stiff back and neck every morning. The street behind the hotel is very noisy due to presence of several bars which continues till 1 am daily. Bathroom has the smallest of the small basin and most of the water falls on the floor instead of the basin whenever you attempt to wash your hands/face. Towels changed regularly. Rooms are also cleaned daily. Breakfast ; No choice. Simple with milk, cornflakes, bread, butter, a single variety of marmalade, 1 sausage, 1 bacon and an egg. The most horrible coffee is probably served here. Overall, you will not regret it, but there's plenty of room for improvements. Will definitely go back again.

Reviews.Title: “perfect for my needs”
Reviews.Author: c00coo
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 4 nights. I had a private room with bathroom/shower. The room was on the 4th floor so it involved many stairs. I was only there to sleep really so it wasn't something that affected me more than when I had to climb them after a long day. I slept well. I had shelf/closet space to keep my things. Hair dryer worked. Hot water. Breakfast was delicious and filling. I found the staff helpful. I got my wake-up calls. There is a phone in the room. I would say if you are a low maintenance person this is fine for you. If you need many amenities and attention, this isn't for you.

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel for travellers with a budget and NO bed bugs!”
Reviews.Author: Sightseeing42
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in an excellent area for great links with public transport. Only a short walk away from Victoria Station and walking distance to all the main attractions in London. At first we were afraid that the rooms were not going to be that great considering the price and previous reviews. However I must say that the 4 person bedroom was spacious and clean (don't expect anything too luxurious). Although the hotel has no lifts and the shower is not big (very narrow), if you're planning to do lots of sightseeing and/or shopping then this hotel is highly recommendable. Even with the person at the reception being a bit unfriendly (not really rude but certainly not helpful). The hotel offers free wireless internet and full English breakfast which is, in my opinion, rare for the price that you are paying.We stayed there for 3 nights and had a small child with us and would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Clean,Warm,Friendly,Good value for Money-Nice Breakfast too!!!”
Reviews.Author: jenoml
Reviews.Content: Very handy for Central London attractions 2 minutes from the Victoria Coach Station and the Victoria Main line Railway Station and Metros. Comes highly recommended.A+++++++

Reviews.Title: “Cheap and Cheerful”
Reviews.Author: di_namite
Reviews.Content: I travelled with my sister and brother-in-law for a 2 day visit to London and we booked this hotel for our overnight stay. We wanted to stay near Victoria Coach Station and after doing a bit of research on the internet decided on this hotel. We had a triple room which cost us £27.50 each for the night, this also included a cooked breakfast. Well what can I say, this is hardly the place you will bump into the likes of the Beckhams but for travellers who prefer to spend more money on enjoyment and less on accommodation then look no further. We had a room in the basement where the dining room was also situated, there were 3 single beds with clean, crisp, white, cotton sheets and the room was lovely and warm as the heating was on permanently. Yes, the decor was dated and in need of a little TLC and the furniture basic but we were not paying Ritz prices. There was plenty of hot water in our en-suite and the shower ran boiling water in the morning. The joy about this room was the fact that it was very, very, quiet. We heard no traffic or any other guests or staff moving about. In the dining room in the morning there was plenty of toast, jam, tea and coffee alongside a very adequate cooked breakfast, which was served by a pleasant waitress. In fact the staff we came across all seemed to be extremely cheerful. London is a fantastic city, we didn't go there to spend our time in the hotel, this was cheap as chips and served our purpose. We will defintely be booking here for our next visit.

Reviews.Title: “Tolerable hotel in great location”
Reviews.Author: DGM71
Reviews.Content: Would we go back? Perhaps, but we'd search elsewhere first. For two nights, this hotel suited our needs by being a short walk to Victoria Station. We expected a typically small London room & no lift to 3rd floor which is exactly what we found. Room was reasonably clean but shower didn't drain well & water collected around our ankles. Hate that!!! Friends on 1st floor had same issue. (It's possible that workman in the building at the time would remedy that situation.) Also, I'm 5'2" and couldn't sit straight on the toilet because my knees hit the shower. Breakfast was decent with a choice of hot or cold fare. Hot meal included an egg, a sausage, beans, & toast. Strangest thing was the night clerk who was sleeping on the floor in the office doorway when we left in the early AM.

Reviews.Title: “HORRIBLE. STAY AWAY. I AM SERIOUS.”
Reviews.Author: asimplejazzlover
Reviews.Content: Oh, this is horrible. The most horrendous hotel I have ever been in my life! Reception seriously needs a training. Amazingly impolite, unfriendly, and unprofessional. GOSH. I dont know what to say here. Just please, stay away. Unless you dont care about the service. Lotsa lotsaaa hotels nearby.

Reviews.Title: “One step above hostel....IF THAT!”
Reviews.Author: AlexandersMom
Reviews.Content: You walk into this hotel to be suffocated by a stink (mold?). The "hotel" is located near Victoria Station, which is convenient BUT for the rate you can stay at a Premier Inn for the same price. Had we not already paid we would have left right away. The rooms are DIRTY and really small. If you have luggage, you can barely fit in the room. The bathrooms are gross and are built like coffins. When we walked into the room I cried! It is disqusting. The mattresses are horrible, so no luck in getting rest.

Reviews.Title: “Close to the center, clean, great value for that money”
Reviews.Author: mungyon
Reviews.Content: This is perfect choice if you would stay only for a couple of days. It is very close to the center, I didn't pay anything for travelling in London. The staff is incredible friendly!!!! The traditional English breakfast was a big surprise. You should know before booking that there is no lift and fridge in the rooms, but anyway, it wasn't said in the description of hotel.

Reviews.Title: “great for the centre of london”
Reviews.Author: oneabbey
Reviews.Content: stayed at this hotel for 3 nights ith 6 other friends walking distance to many sights/ our room was on top floor which was a bit of a climb but had great views of the london eye/breakfast was good but a bit early you had to be down before 9//staff were very pleasant// hotel was clean but good be due a tidy up and lick of paint etc //but then you would probly have to pay more than the £60.00 they charge at the moment///would use this hotel if i was back in london///also its not far from victoria 5 mins ///there is a bar in hotel but was closed for refurb

Reviews.Title: “good location, but the toliet smells.....”
Reviews.Author: Joanie_tw
Reviews.Content: Well, the location is very good. I booked a double room for my mum and me, and the room and the bathroom are small. The size is not the problem since I expected that it is normal size in London, but the toliet smells. I had an ensuite room, so the smell of the toliet spreads into entire room when the toliet door opens. It may be better to book rooms without bathroom if you want to stay there.

Reviews.Title: “Basic but perfectly adequate”
Reviews.Author: Gillybeanie
Reviews.Content: We'd decided to have a couple of days away, and bought funfares with National Express to go to London. I wanted to visit the Science Museum and also do one of the open topped London Bus Tours. We looked for cheap overnight accomodation with breakfast included, in the Victoria area (our coach destination). None of the recent reviews were particularly positive, so booking the Stanley House was a gamble. The location was excellent, it was within 5 minutes walk of Victoria coach & train stations, and there was a convenient Sainsbury Express en route to the hotel. From the outside, the hotel looked smart and inviting. The reception staff were pleasant once we engaged them in conversation. There is a £5 deposit for your room & front door key, but we weren't charged this. Our room was basic, but with everything we needed; the sheets were crisp and clean, there were spare blankets and pillows, and several spare loo rolls! There were plenty of drawers available, a wardrobe, a desk and a hairdryer. OK, the paintwork was tired and the hotel interior generally a bit grubby, but not where it mattered. The loo, washbasin & shower were clean, and the towels were replaced daily. The signs advising you of the breakfast times varied, but we sussed out it was available between 7.30 and 9.00. The breakfast room is in the basement, it was crowded but it encouraged us to talk to other residents sharing our table, so was quite sociable. Again, the staff were pleasant and polite, and worked hard to ensure everyone was served quickly. We had orange juice, sausages, bacon, beans and an egg, then plenty of toast, tea or coffee. Others there had cornflakes, I think this was instead of the fried breakfast. We walked to the Science Museum, took us about 45 minutes, and spent all day there before walking back. Probably further than a lot of people might fancy walking, but it gave us the chance to admire the wonderful architecture of the buildings in this area. There is a pub about 5 minutes walk from the hotel, where they serve a good meal, specialising in different flavoured sausages. Actually, we got Pork & Red Onion even when we asked for Venison, but hunger prevented us from pointing out the error! They were delicious, as was the fine selection of real ales. The pub was quiet at lunchtime, but really buzzing in the evening, quietened down again about 9pm. On the day of our departure, we had to vacate the room by 10am, but were allowed to leave our luggage (at our own risk) in the lounge until our coach went at 6pm. This enabled us to spend the day hopping on and off the bus tour, without the luggage. Also, we were able to use (the plentiful) toilets at the hotel before our journey home.

Reviews.Title: “Good for frugal traveler”
Reviews.Author: FrugalTravelMom
Reviews.Content: We got a family room (two double beds) for the best price I could find in the area (Victoria Station--good for connecting to all parts of central London). The breakfast was fine...nothing fancy, but enough food for all. The room was clean. The staff was not particularly friendly, but wasn't rude either. They let us in early to drop off our bags...which was nice. The biggest negative was that there was supposed to be internet, but it was only functioning sporadically...to the point where my husband couldn't get on long enough to conduct his business. He tried to find an internet cafe, and there were some, but he didn't want to pay what they were asking.

Reviews.Title: “Just Ok”
Reviews.Author: peggypeg
Reviews.Content: This hotel is just Ok. The rooms are quite big but not very clean. Look carefully at the towels! The breakfast is not excellent either and the reception guys are not so friendly... Good point: the location! Close to Victoria underground station, westminster abbaye and big ben.

Reviews.Title: “Stanley House the best budget hotel, so far”
Reviews.Author: Roland m
Reviews.Content: I have been to London staying in budget hotels twice before last weeks trip, and Stanley House Hotel is clearly the best one so far. The location is terrific, only 10 minutes from Victoria Station (where the trains from Gatwick Airport arrives), and of course as close to Victoria tube station. We could check in to our room already before 10 AM, which meant that we didn't have to pay through our noses (£6,50/ bag) to keep the suitcases at Victoria station's luggage room. You have a 15 minutes walk to Westminster, the HP and London Eye, and a wide variety of restaurants and pubs within five minutes walk from the hotel. Out triple room (#33) on the ground floor was clean and big enough. The TV was small, but new, and the shower tight, but working without any problems. The people at the reception were service minded and quick to respond to questions and additional requirements. For the first time in a budget hotel we got more than the usual "Continental breakfast", and were served “English breakfast” (eggs, bacon, sausage and beans) and corn flakes in addition to more than you could eat of toast, butter and jam. The single glass window doesn’t shut out the sounds of traffic on Belgrave Road, but since it’s a quiet street with not much traffic after 10 PM we had three good night sleeps on good beds and pillows. I would like to recommend this hotel (at least if you’re booking triple room) to anyone looking for a good enough budget hotel in London. The £70 a night for triple makes this place a good value hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Oh my god!!!”
Reviews.Author: davebirty
Reviews.Content: First of all, the location was brilliant. Come out of Victoria shopping centre and turn left, walk about 5 mins and your there. A taxi from Trafalger Square was £6.40. Was quite clean. Now the bad bits. The room was very small and in the basement, opposite the breakfast room. the en-suite bathroom was a corner of the room with a studded wall around it that didn't reach the top of the walls. Also the extractor fan was very loud and took a long time to go off! Thier was a small tv with some digital channels. One plug socket in the room( the TV was plugged in that!!) The bed was very soft with a bright pink blanket on it with a bright blue blanket under that. (sheets were changed everyday) Their was a really bad draft coming from the window. i moved the net curtain and found that the window was stuck open. I fixed this!! I think someone had opened it because the central heating was on constantly and the room was really really hot!!! We only went for breakfast on the first morning because it was terrible!!! We got tea/coffee, 1 sausage, some beans and 2 fried eggs. NO BACON!!! what a complete waste of time! So in conclusion, steer clear of this hotel. We found many others around the same price, i'd try one of them before this one! I wish we had paid a little more now but hey!!

Reviews.Title: “Doesn't deserve its rating”
Reviews.Author: Mattinbrum
Reviews.Content: Good points: Location Clean Bad points: Staff unfriendly Old furniture and fittings No soap or tea and coffee in room; no sink plug! I've stayed in many budget hotels in London and I can't understand how this one has achieved this rating. It's not terrible, but its below average, even for this price range.

Reviews.Title: “HOTEL? - SHOULD READ HOSTEL!!”
Reviews.Author: Deano64
Reviews.Content: What a dump! Arrived at 5pm, checked in slightly concerned by the scruffy reception, several males were hanging around the reception area (I assume they were staff?). Paid £50 for a special offer double en suite room previously booked on-line, I was also asked to pay a £5 key deposit. On entering the second floor room (#39) I found a small scruffy room, all be it with a double bed (covered in an old pink candlewick and worn sheets). The furniture was old and tatty, nothing matched, an over bed lamp had electrical wires hanging from the fitting, the main room light was a fluresent tube. The en suite was a partition corner of the room, the top being a foot lower than the (water stained) ceiling. Just enough room to turn round, mould stained shower seals and a very noisy fan. No teak and coffee facilities and no smoke detector fitted??!! I returned to reception to complain about the room to be told this was a standard room and nothing better was available. I decided not to stay and checked out, requests for a part refund were refused (this will be pursued). I would not stay here if the rooms were being offered for free - DON'T STAY AT THIS HOTEL YOU CAN DO FAR BETTER IN LONDON

Reviews.Title: “Good choice for families, great location”
Reviews.Author: wrstevens
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Stanley House at the beginning and end of our trip to UK. Great location two blocks from Victoria Station. Reasonable price for downtown London. We had a family room with double and two single beds for family of four (kids 4 and 2). Reception was very helpful and friendly. Room was large, clean, and quiet. Good full English breakfast. Lots of good restaurants, coffee shops, and grocery stores in the neighborhood. Trains, tube, and busses close by. Would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “It's ok...”
Reviews.Author: Jennie_in_the_City
Reviews.Content: Recently stayed at the Stanley House, and the place is quite ok. In my opinion though, it is more like a bed & breakfast than a hotel. The room was clean enough (tiles in bathroom could do with some extra scrubbing...), beds were made and clean towels everyday which was a nice surprise. However, before you go I would def. reconfirm booking and roomtype. Our room was booked just the week before our stay- a triple room was booked online. In most hotels a triple room means 3 beds, just the same way a twin room means 2 beds... But when we got there our room only had 1 double and 1 single bed. Talked to the man at reception and was told they didnt have any rooms with 3 beds! I said that they have rooms with 3 beds on the internet and was then told that there were non available...I asked that if there was a triple room available the next day we might be able to change rooms and he would let us know. Surprise surprise, we didn' t here anymore, not that we asked again anyway. Also asked for an extra blanket and sheet which we never got either... The first morning there was no hot water at all ( might be because we got up VERY early and the immersion hadnt been turned on yet??) There was some screaming when 3 girls tried to have a shower in icecold water. After this episode we all managed to have a warm/hot shower each every morning. But, it is true, the bathroom and the showers are tiny. All in all, if you are on a budget and dont want to spend too much on accomation then the Stanley House is ok. It is basic, but fairly clean compared to some other places in the same price range and the location is very good just a couple of minutes walk from Victoria Station.

Reviews.Title: “Cold Shiver”
Reviews.Author: Griffen
Reviews.Content: I guess the rooms were clean, but the shower was a microscopic area and the hot water lasted 1.5 showers twice. It is convenient for Victoria station but try somewhere is is my candid recommendation.

Reviews.Title: “bit of a dump,toilets out side of room”
Reviews.Author: lechatnoir7
Reviews.Content: broken furniture.. toilet was Upstairs !!!!!!! smelly from recent paint.. unable to keep window open at night due to common balcony. dirty blanket . good location good breakfast. NOT reccomended .

Reviews.Title: “Stayed 4 times and recommend it for the price”
Reviews.Author: englishatheart
Reviews.Content: The price is great for a 10 minute walk to Buckingham Palace. It was always clean and the staff is really nice. The gave my group a gift for staying 2 times in March and 2 in November. It's in a nice part of town and sooo close to London Victoria and the Gatwick Express. The English Breakfast isn't bad either. As with any European hotel for this price. The stairs are tiny and so are the Bathrooms, but hey you're staying in Westminster for a great price...

Reviews.Title: “Great location, Good only to sleep over”
Reviews.Author: igorek
Reviews.Content: We were coming from US and stayed 9 nights. Perfect location, 10 minutes walk to either Westminster Abbey or Buckingham Palace. Rooms are small but cleam. The bathroom is minuscule. I paid 60 pounds per night - it is a good rate for London, if you are coming only to sleep at night. For $120 I can have a 4star accomodation in US, not in London, where the real exchange rate is 1:1. The breakfast was simple and served by east european woman. Everyday is eggs, sausage/bacon, toasts, tea/cofee - seems to be a true english tradition. The room was cleaned every day, the sheets every other day. No shampoo. The location seems to be safe at night.

Reviews.Title: “Worth it!”
Reviews.Author: tjs06
Reviews.Content: My husband and i stayed at Stanley in April 07 for 1 night. Reception was good and welcomed us nicely.We were at room no. 4. Lovely room! It was clean and the bedsheet was nicely done and crispy clean! Bed was quite squeeky but comfortable otherwise. The bathroom was tidy too. Shower was a bit of a squeeze but the hot water was very nice and we enjoyed a hot shower. Breakfast was average but the staff we're friendly. In general Stanley is not that bad at all. The price is all worth it! Very good location for going round. It's just walking distance from Buckingham Palace and other tourist spot. There were numerous restaurants and shops arund the area too which are very helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Very satisfactory at the price”
Reviews.Author: helencrowe
Reviews.Content: y daughter and I booked online for our holiday in Sept/05 for two weeks. We had a ground floor ensuite room which was very comfortable and, although old, was clean. The shower head needed replacing. Breakfast was more than adequate and we found being close to (1) Salisbury's deli, numerous restaurants, launderette as well as Victoria Station made it one of the most accessible B&B hotels we have stayed in. We were so pleased that we booked again in Sept/07 for 3 weekds. There had been some upgrading done but unfortunately the room we wanted on the main floor was not available even though specifically requested. The downstairs room was large and comfortable and once we came to an understanding with the staff about noise was great. We were quite satisfied with the accommodation at the price quoted and would not hesitate to stay again in the future. The staff were most helpful and friendly at all times.

Reviews.Title: “We were very satisfied”
Reviews.Author: janasaska
Reviews.Content: We occupied twin room standard - shower en-suite. The room is small, and bathroom very small but it is enougth for us. Everything is clean, they clear there every day. Staff is very helpfull and friendly. It is advisable for tourists, there is enougth room for sleeping, but small for doing everything. There was recontruction in another sector of hotel but paints were smell.

Reviews.Title: “I like this hotel! A Trip Advisor member from Calgary, Alberta, Canada.”
Reviews.Author: bamma1947
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the Stanley House Hotel quite a few times over the years the last stay being the nights of October 5th and 6th, 2006 and find it good value for the money. I usually get a room without an en suite bathroom and this costs 35.00 pounds sterling per night if I book it online. The breakfast is ample and a good start to the day. It is very close to Victoria Station so one can catch a train, bus or the underground from there. I usually ask for Room 6 which has French doors which lead onto a shared balcony where one can sit if the weather permits. These French doors of course can be locked when not in use. If you want a safe, clean and reasonable place this is the one to choose.

Reviews.Title: “you get what you paid for!!!!”
Reviews.Author: TERRY H
Reviews.Content: we stayed at the stanley house numerous times the past years it is always basic but good value (what do u want for 35 pds a nite in downtown london) so i would recommend it but buyer beware

HotelInfo.Name: Stanley House
HotelInfo.Address: 19-21 Belgrave Road, London SW1V 1RB, England
